stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Enforcer
[Gender] Male
[Combat Experience] Half a year
[Place of Birth] Laterano
[Date of Birth] Jan 30
[Race] Sankta
[Height] 176cm
[Infection Status]
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Enforcer, citizen of Laterano, entitled to the privileges listed in Clauses 1 through 13 of the Laterano Constitution, is an executor of the Notarial Hall who just passed his training term. During the Summit of Nations, he was involved in riots caused by heretics. Following the incident's conclusion, he was recommended by Operator Executor. In accordance to an agreement between Rhodes Island and the Notarial Hall, he now assists Rhodes Island as a specialist operator.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, the operator is believed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Enforcer shows no signs of Originium infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.12u/L
Operator Enforcer rarely comes into contact with Originium, but consumes coffee in excess. Moderation is encouraged.

Operator Enforcer, real name Ezell Pastore, quickly won over everyone's hearts shortly after arriving at Rhodes Island thanks to his gentle, friendly demeanor and helpful attitude. It is hard to imagine that Executor and Enforcer, both executors from the same Laterano Notarial Hall, have such dramatically different ways of handling people and situations. From this, we can infer that Laterano may have various ways of protecting their citizens' civil rights. Enforcer prefers a more diplomatic approach of listening and mediation, rather than resolving disputes through physical means. He tries to fully understand the intentions and arguments of all parties, before finally resolving the conflict by finding a solution everyone can accept.
However, this does not mean that Enforcer is incapable of fighting—far from it. During his operator exam, Enforcer displayed stunning combat prowess, particularly in close-quarters. Though he may lack experience in emergency situations, as far as his skills are concerned, he is very likely more than capable of dragging everyone to the negotiation table, one way or another.
Great, the Notarial Hall even has enforcers like him! The kid even offered to help me whip up a cup of coffee!
—Closure

As we understand it, Enforcer recently completed his training period as an executor of the Notarial Hall, certainly no small feat for someone so young. Under normal circumstances, when a citizen of Laterano receives their patron firearm at the age of twelve, they still need an extensive period of study to truly master using it. After passing a number of examinations and obtaining the corresponding qualification certificates, including the Laterano Firearm Carry and Usage Permit, they formally earn the authorization to use their gun in self-defense, escort duty, ceremonies, and other purposes. Additionally, every few years, gun-owning citizens of Laterano need to bring their patron firearms to the relevant branches of the Notarial Hall and complete gun inspections before they can continue to legally use their 'partners'.
However, the education and training required of a Notarial Hall executor goes far beyond that.
Working in the Notarial Hall is a difficult task, and each official requires a deep understanding of several layers of laws, regulations, and rules. In other words, it can be said that many in the Notarial Hall are profound legal scholars. On top of all this, an executor must also have excellent gun-handling skills, and most difficult of all, must deal with situations where they might be forced to point the muzzle at their own kind. This is not something that can be learned from a textbook.
Due to both the Sankta's laws and their own empathy, it is inherently difficult for one to harbor hostilities towards another, or even to hide their hostilities. Even if it would not violate the law, one still needs to overcome massive psychological pressure, as well as a sense of moral condemnation, to lift one's hand against a fellow Sankta. Perhaps Operator Executor represents the ideal state that skilled, experienced executors should aspire towards. However, Operator Enforcer still managed to pass his Notarial Hall training, all while maintaining his gentle demeanor.
With a smile on his face, he told the HR operator that he had no special secrets to accomplish this. Simply a bit more patience.

When Enforcer arrived at Rhodes Island to handle the necessary onboarding procedures, he had with him a young Sankta girl named Cecelia. What a mature and adorable child. Even though she won't be here for long, she has already become good friends with almost all the other children here, and they all look forward to seeing her again. This came as a surprise to us. From what we knew, Cecelia grew up in a very unique environment. Isolated at home for a long time because of her identity, she never had any contact with her peers, and was not given a chance to get along with them or develop bonds. However, Cecelia did not exhibit any social impairments, personality flaws, or psychological problems usually present in children growing up under similar circumstances. Her deceased guardian must've painstakingly nurtured her emotional growth. Undoubtedly, she has been given more than enough love and companionship.
According to Operator Enforcer's explanations, Cecelia's health is not in stable condition, and, following Dr. Kal'tsit's judgment, Rhodes Island will provide her with as much medical assistance as possible. Unfortunately though, there really is not much we can do for this lovely young lady. Dr. Kal'tsit can only provide a few bits of basic medical advice on diet and rest. Given that Cecelia will travel to areas near Kazdel, it will be difficult for Medical to conduct follow-up health monitoring. However, Cecelia assures us that she can take care of herself, and we have little choice but to trust in this precocious girl. After all, Enforcer will be accompanying her along the way. An executor should have the skills to handle whatever challenges may arise on the way.
It's worth noting that in the period before leaving for Kazdel, Enforcer often spoke with the operators in charge of educating the minors at Rhodes Island, consulting them in great detail on all the recommended textbooks and supplementary materials from primary education through secondary education, and downloading everything onto his terminal.

[Classified Log]
Cecelia's condition is very unique. Unexpectedly, Operator Enforcer seems to have a deeper understanding of this than we do, perhaps due to what they experienced during Laterano's Summit of Nations.
That's right. The girl named Cecelia has a mix of Sankta and Sarkaz blood. Despite the deep hatred between these two races, there are always those who can overcome the barriers built over thousands of years. To be honest, this girl is not alone. Emotions have a lot more power than one would expect.
The truly remarkable thing is that even as a mixed-blood, Cecelia's halo still shines bright above her head, though somewhat unstably. Children between Sankta and foreigners can never be Sankta, and this should have been ironclad law. Their haloes and wings of light are proof of their acceptance by the law, which shuns all else.
What, then, does Cecelia's existence mean?
We have too little information to work with.
Neither Cecelia nor Ezell seemed insistent on asking this question, which is likely the wisest course of action. For us, what truly matters isn't the meaning given to one's existence, but what meaning that existence can go on to create. The journey ahead of them is destined to be rough, and there will be no shortage of trials and tribulations. They may well tread a thorny path, and even come home empty-handed.
But their journey will never be in vain, and we wish all the luck in the world to these two youths.

Operator Enforcer always carries a coffee mug with him when he works, which always contains the same kind of black coffee—made from a very bitter bean, with not a single granule of sugar added. However, like most Laterans, he is also extremely fond of sweets such as cakes and cookies. In his own words, his choice of black coffee is only to help him focus on his work.
Yet when he finishes his work, Enforcer will pull out a separate coffee brewing set. He often spends hours at a time comparing the differences in flavor caused by varying degrees of roasting, configuring the perfect blend of coffee bean varieties, optimizing the proper ratio of cream and sugar, and even subscribing to the Bolívar Agricultural Magazine just to read the coffee planting columns—even though the magazine is often delivered months late. If Enforcer ever invites you to try the new blend of coffee he whipped up after work, be sure to accept his offer: you won't be disappointed.
However, if you ever accept a cup of coffee from him during work hours, be sure to determine whose cup it is.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.
<color name=#ffffff>EPOQUE Collection New Arrivals/Paper Wing. White jacket on mint-green T-shirt, refreshingly cool for the summer.</color>

skills.desc: The next attack pushes the target towards the attack direction <@ba.vup>significantly</>, <$ba.stun>stunning</> it for <@ba.vup>{stun}</> seconds if the target collides with High Ground.

Immediately pushes back all enemies within range <@ba.vup>greatly</> in the direction this unit is facing, additionally <$ba.stun>stunning</> them for <@ba.vup>{forcer_s_2[hit_directly].stun}</> seconds (the <$ba.stun>stun</> duration is increased to <@ba.vup>{stun}</> seconds if the target collides with High Ground). If the target collides with another enemy, the enemy will also be <$ba.stun>stunned</> for <@ba.vup>{forcer_s_2[brush].stun}</> seconds.

modules.desc:
Operator Enforcer has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for physically distancing the enemy via applied force so as to preserve the front.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Specialist Operator during field operations to exercise Push Stroker responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

'You want to work at my patisserie? A Notarial Hall executor?!'
'Yes.'
......
No matter the reason Ezell gives, the patisserie owner finds it hard to comprehend why an executor wants to do this of all things. Still, Laterano's Sankta are famed for doing as they please, and he has no reason to refuse, so the patisserie is where he lets Ezell be.
At first, Ezell's work is rough around the edges, clearly too stiff in copying what he sees. He unfailingly takes down all the necessary ingredients, amounts, ratios, and methods in his notebook.
Some, of course, are floored to recognize what Ezell is. There's even speculation that some major case is developing—why else would a Notarial Hall executor go into hiding here, like this? Still, the week ends without anything of note. And just like at the Notarial Hall, Ezell is never late. But no matter how busy the shop is, he never works overtime, always punctual to clock out.
'Cecelia, I'm home. Here, cookies.'
'Thanks, Mister Ezell!'
'They're really good! Mister Ezell, did you make them?'
'Mm-hm. In a few more days, once I've made the preparations, we'll head out to see your papà.'
'Okay!'
......
'What? You're quitting, right now? *sigh* You've put so much effort into learning patisserie, you know. Even taught you my secret recipe, hahaha.'
'I'm sorry.'
......
'Ezell, the intel you need's all here.'
'Thank you, Richele.'
'Once you're checked in at Rhodes Island, got an idea of where you're going next?'
'Hmm... based on our present intel, I think I do, roughly.
'Let's go, Cecelia.'
......
If you took a look through the notebook Ezell carries, you'd find it crammed full of things you'd expect from someone like him. Notes on his work, timetables, coffee brewing instructions, etc.
But on one page, in immature handwriting, is 'I want to eat Lateran sweets,' contrasted by a dessert recipe below in Ezell's script.
'They'd be hard to find in any stores after leaving Laterano, and would spoil on the way if prepared in bulk beforehand, so the best plan was to learn to make them myself.'
'I know how implausible leaving Laterano to find a Sarkaz is, given the current circumstances. I have enough faith to stay by Cecelia's side the whole way, but I know that for her, the journey to come will reveal itself to be an ordeal like nothing else.'
'So I've told her that whenever she wants to do something, she can write in this book. No matter how unrealistic, I'll earnestly plan it out, execute it, and achieve it. So that on this journey, Cecelia's heart remains ever filled with hope.'
Thus explains Ezell.
'Ah! Cecelia, wait!'
'That's black coffee! You won't grow big if you drink that!'

voice_lines.voiceText: Doctor, do all these files need to be filled out by today? It's just, with this much left... so be it, I'll help you out. If we sort this out together, it shouldn't eat into our break hours.
When I decided to violate orders and act independently, I was expecting a severe reprimand. What I never predicted was that Mr. Executor would recommend me here…
Doctor, do you know if there's anywhere to borrow storybooks here? Operators at the Medical Department have asked me to care for the children under treatment, and I'd like to read them a tale or two.

The Notarial Hall employs more than just field executors; there's plenty of civil service posts. I actually aspired for one in the first place, but when it came to the evaluation, I accidentally... um, collapsed a few rooms in the examination venue, which got me put in my current position.
I don't rue leaving Laterano; it was my own choice. There's so many places I'm still not familiar with, but I feel that being able to see the breadth of Terra like I am now is more than worth it.

The Sankta ability to perceive each other's states of mind is common sense to us, not something that needs real elaboration. But I'm sad to say, at some point, I suddenly realized I lost that reciprocation with my own people. It wasn't any physical disease, I just... began to think.

Stop, Doctor! Phew. You took the wrong cup—that's the espresso I brewed for myself, with no sugar. Yours was the one next to it. Sorry, I assume it was too bitter? ...It's fine, it tastes great? A—Alright, I'm glad you like it.

Doctor, could you lend me your comms device for a moment? I usually turn my comms off after work, and don't get any messages. ...There we go, I've granted you emergency contact privileges. You can get in touch with me whenever for whatever, this way.

You seem to be having plenty of fun. Yes, I can tell. Joy, sorrow, anger... emotions can propagate between all of us, regardless of what city or race we come from. When you're happy, it's no wonder I can sense it too.
Doctor, are you still awake? It's just a little longer now. We can be on break once this work's done. Here, I have your coffee.

Hello, I'm a dispatch at Rhodes Island via a transfer agreement with the Notarial Hall. A codename? Let's think... You can call me Enforcer. Here's the files pertaining to the agreement. I'll be counting on you to show me the ropes.
Brilliant. It'll be quick for me to adapt to this combat style.
A promotion... Is this going to impact my specific working hours?

Maybe it's immature of me to approach things this way, but every step I've taken up to today is of my own choosing, and I'm satisfied with that. Doctor, thank you so much for watching over me all this time.
A new mission? Understood.
If we run into any contingency situations, I will independently judge how to proceed.
The sooner we're out, the sooner we're on break.
Do we have to compensate for damages incurred in combat?
By your order.
Enforcing.
This battle is by no means out of animosity.
We all simply have differing viewpoints, no more.
This is as far as you go.
A struggle with an ideal to support it is far from meaningless.
I will hear you all out afterwards.
Be careful not to fall from here, everyone.
They have what they uphold, and we have ours. Thank you for the willingness to realize, Doctor.
Mission complete. Good work, Doctor. Let's take a good break once we're back.
The ones who ran—did they give up? Or, maybe...
No need to be so dejected. We can still try again.
So these are the renowned Rhodes Island dormitories? Very... well, frugal.
Careful! You could've spilled the coffee.
I wear eyemasks while I'm on break, so I can only tell you all apart by your footsteps. Was that just now... the Doctor?
Arknights.

This is my first time welcoming in the New Year somewhere beyond Laterano. There's still plenty of places I'm not used to, but I've tried so many things I never tried before, and that... feels pretty good. Happy New Year, Doctor.
Want some coffee, Doctor?

Doctor, happy birthday. It seems you've already gotten plenty of cakes today. So, here's my present—a mug of premium coffee. It is totally devoid of sugar, but if you taste carefully, you can pick out a fruity, caramel sweetness... Doctor, is something wrong? Doctor?

There are so many fellow Sankta aboard Rhodes Island. The sympathy might be missing, but I can see the joy and blessing on their faces as plain as day. Is it because they've all found a goal worth devoting themselves to here? If so, Doctor, I'll appreciate any future guidance you have for me.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Reception Room, Clue search speed increases by <@cc.vup>10%</>
When this Operator is assigned to the Reception Room, increases Clue search speed by <@cc.vup>35%</>, and Morale consumed per hour by <@cc.vdown>+2</>
